import { Paragraph } from '@looker/components'
import { Editor, excludedProps } from '@looker/storybook'
import { ArgsTable, Meta } from '@storybook/addon-docs'
import storyDefault from '!!raw-loader!./Default'
import storyMultilineTruncate from '!!raw-loader!./MultilineTruncate'
import storyTruncate from '!!raw-loader!./Truncate'
import storyTextAlign from '!!raw-loader!./TextAlign'

<Meta component={Paragraph} title="Docs/Paragraph" />

# Paragraph

Renders a block level `<Paragraph />` element on the page.

<Editor code={storyDefault} />

By default, paragraphs inherit the font size of the parent element.

## Truncate

At times you may want your `<Paragraph />` to truncate instead of the text wrapping, the `truncate` property will do that for you. For a multiline truncate, use `truncateLines`.

<Editor code={storyTruncate} />
<Editor code={storyMultilineTruncate} />

## Text Alignment

You can use the `textAlign` property to change the alignment of the rendered text, below is an example with aligned text put into `<Card />`s.

<Editor code={storyTextAlign} />

<ArgsTable of={Paragraph} exclude={excludedProps} />
